Package edu.ncsu.csc216.tracker.model

Class RequirementsTrackerModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.tracker.model.RequirementsTrackerModel
  • public class RequirementsTrackerModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Second class used to manage the collection of Requirements. This method calls upon RequirementsList for its get, add, remove, and execute methods, while calling RequirementsWriter and RequirementsReader for output and input.
    Author:
    Troy Boone

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addRequirement​(java.lang.String summary, java.lang.String acceptanceTestId)
      Adds the requirement by calling RequirementsList executeCommand on the requirement with matching requirement id reqId
      void createNewRequirementsList()
      Simple reset for reqList
      void deleteRequirementById​(int reqId)
      Deletes the requirement with matching requirement id reqId by calling RequirementsList deleteRequirementById
      void executeCommand​(int reqId, Command c)
      Executes the command c by calling RequirementsList executeCommand on the requirement with matching requirement id reqId
      static RequirementsTrackerModel getInstance()
      Getter for RequirementsTrackerModel singleton.
      Requirement getRequirementById​(int reqId)
      Getter for requirement by using the reqId.
      java.lang.Object[][] getRequirementListAsArray()
      Makes a new 2d object array called catalog which is then filled with requirements information in the format of requirement id - state - summary.
      void loadRequirementsFromFile​(java.lang.String filename)
      Calls RequirementsReader to handle reading from a file.
      void saveRequirementsToFile​(java.lang.String filename)

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RequirementsTrackerModel getInstance()
        Getter for RequirementsTrackerModel singleton. If there has not been one made, this method will initialize it
        Returns:
        singleton

      • saveRequirementsToFile

        public void saveRequirementsToFile​(java.lang.String filename)
        Calls RequirementsWriter to handle writing to a file. This method then will iterate over the reqList and add each of them to the writter.
        Parameters:
        filename - the location of the output file

      • loadRequirementsFromFile

        public void loadRequirementsFromFile​(java.lang.String filename)
        Calls RequirementsReader to handle reading from a file. This method will then take the list of requirements sent from RequirementsReader and add it to a fresh RequirementsList
        Parameters:
        filename - the location of the input file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file cannot be found

      • createNewRequirementsList

        public void createNewRequirementsList()
        Simple reset for reqList

      • getRequirementListAsArray

        public java.lang.Object[][] getRequirementListAsArray()
        Makes a new 2d object array called catalog which is then filled with requirements information in the format of requirement id - state - summary. This is then returned
        Returns:
        catalog the GUI displayable array

      • getRequirementById

        public Requirement getRequirementById​(int reqId)
        Getter for requirement by using the reqId. Calls upon RequirementsList method
        Parameters:
        reqId - the id of the requirement that is being found
        Returns:
        the requirement with matching Id

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand​(int reqId,
                           Command c)
        Executes the command c by calling RequirementsList executeCommand on the requirement with matching requirement id reqId
        Parameters:
        reqId - the id of the requirement that the command is being executed on
        c - the command the requirement is executing

      • deleteRequirementById

        public void deleteRequirementById​(int reqId)
        Deletes the requirement with matching requirement id reqId by calling RequirementsList deleteRequirementById
        Parameters:
        reqId - the id of the requirement that is being deleted

      • addRequirement

        public void addRequirement​(java.lang.String summary,
                           java.lang.String acceptanceTestId)
        Adds the requirement by calling RequirementsList executeCommand on the requirement with matching requirement id reqId
        Parameters:
        summary - the requirement summary
        acceptanceTestId - the requirement acceptanceTestId
